info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 04 at 8:47AM MST by NWS Billings
info.description: ...AN AREA OF HEAVY SNOW WILL AFFECT SOUTHEASTERN BIG HORN... SOUTHWESTERN POWDER RIVER...SOUTH CENTRAL ROSEBUD AND SHERIDAN COUNTIES... At 842 AM MST, an area of heavy snow was located along a line extending from 18 miles south of Busby to 13 miles northwest of Dayton. Heavy snow and blowing snow will cause visibilities to drop below a quarter of a mile at times. A quick inch or two of snow is possible over the next couple of hours. Travel on Interstate 90 through southern Big Horn County and Sheridan County will be difficult. Locations impacted include... Sheridan, Ranchester, Dayton, Big Horn, Clearmont, Birney, Leiter, Wyola, Tongue River Reservoir, Parkman, Banner, Moorhead, Arvada, Otter, Kirby, Rosebud Battlefield Park, Ucross and Northern Cheyenne Indian Reservation. Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time when traveling.
